turn.1: What happened in the 18th Chess Olympiad?
turn.2: 18th Chess Olympiad The 18th Chess Olympiad, organized by FIDE and comprising an open team tournament, as well as several other events designed to promote the game of chess, took place between October 17 and November 7, 1968, in Lugano, Switzerland.
turn.4: The Soviet team with six GMs, led by world champion Petrosian, lived up to expectations and won their ninth consecutive gold medals, with Yugoslavia and Bulgaria taking the silver and bronze, respectively.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: A total of 53 teams entered the competition and were divided into seven preliminary groups of seven or eight teams each.
turn.8: The top two from each group advanced to Final A, the teams placed third-fourth to Final B, no.
turn.10: 5-6 to Final C, and the rest to Final D.
turn.11: Is there anything else that happened with the Olympiad?
turn.12: Preliminary head-to-head results were carried over to the finals, so no teams met more than once.
